intro: Picris kotschyi, commonly known as the Persian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Picris kotschyi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
